short_summary: Supply and installation of fire extinguishers for MV Madeleine II
description: Detailed requirements and requirements for the contract can be found on the website provided in the notice URL.
full_summary:
**Tender Announcement**
======================

**Tender Title (English)**: MV Madeleine II Fire Extinguisher Replacement
**Tender Title (French)**: Remplacement des extincteurs du NM Madeleine II

**Reference Number**: WS4326947355-Doc4332634474
**Solicitation Number**: WS4326947355
**Publication Date**: November 30, 2023
**Tender Closing Date**: December 15, 2023, 2:00 p.m. EST
**Expected Contract Start Date**: December 20, 2023
**Expected Contract End Date**: None

**Procurement Information**
---------------------------

* **Procurement Category**: Goods
* **Procurement Method**: Competitively-Tendered
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity**: Quebec (except National Capital Region)
* **Regions of Delivery**: Quebec (except National Capital Region)

**Contracting Entity and End User Information**
-----------------------------------------------

* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End User Entity**: Department of Transport (TC)

**Contact Information**
----------------------

* **Name**: Christopher Young, SPAC/PSPC
* **Email**: <christopher.young@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca>

**Notice and Attachment Information**
---------------------------------------

* **Notice URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18156428?extsite=MTgxNTY0MjhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Tender Description**
---------------------

Transport Canada requires the supply and installation of fire extinguishers for the MV Madeleine II, with completion expected by March 31, 2024. This tender is being issued under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). Bidders are advised to review the bid documents and evaluation criteria in the attached notice.

Highlights
-----------

* Bidders may access the tender notice and bid documents through the link above.
* Bidders must submit their bids electronically through the online tendering platform.
* Bids must be received by 2:00 p.m. EST on December 15, 2023.

It is the responsibility of bidders to ensure that they comply with all applicable laws and regulations.
